answers.author: Anna Read
answers.text:
In Ithaca, New York, there is a local currency called the Ithaca Hours.  Since 1991, local businesses have been able to opt into the program, which encourages investment in the local economy. Currently there are more than 900 participants and over $100,000 in Ithaca Hours in circulation.  More information is available at http://www.ithacahours.org/index.html.

answers.author: Mark Medlar
answers.text:
The City of Orlando, FL has had a buy local program for a little over a year.  Individuals can pick up or have a card (the size of a credit card) mailed to them free of charge.  Discounts include games of bowling, restaurant tabs and even closing costs on real estate.  The program is scheduled to continue through the next fiscal year and will be considered for renewal.
http://www.buylocalorlando.net/index.htm

author: Gary Palmer
text:
Anyone have any experience using "key fobs" to promote local merchants?
Our merchants association is exploring the idea of using "key fobs" in order to promote a campaign for people to shop locally.  This would require local businesses to have selected items on sale for people who have these "buy local" fobs.
Any information or direction would be greatly appreciated.
Gary Palmer
title: "Buy Local" Incentives
